Node.definition: = town; ◄ located in northern Mesopotamia near Mosul on the east bank of the Tigris (חִדֶּקֶל) ► built by Nimrod (נִמְרֹד) after the flood (מַבּוּל) ancient capital of Assyria (אַשּׁוּר) preached against by the prophet Jonah (יֹונָה)
= written document; made of papyrus or parchment; either as a single sheet or several sheets sewn together and rolled for storage
= experience by which humans see something in a dream or trance, or as a supernatural apparition
= man; ◄ from Elkosh (אֶלְקֹשִׁי) ► prophet (נָבִיא)
= person from Elkosh
with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= attitude by which deities insist on receiving the attention and commitment that is in keeping with one's status
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= person engaged in a certain activity
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger
= action in which humans or deities harm (other) humans in return for an injury or wrong, and so find relief from their anger
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
primarily used in poetry: = person that opposes other people and so is a cause of distress to others
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: long of nostrils, long of breath; hence: = pertaining to not being given to anger
literally: long of nostrils; hence: = ability to restrain oneself from expressing one's displeasure; ≈ regarded as wisdom
= state in which an event has a high intensity
= state in which humans, animals or deities have the ability to perform actions, or to prevail in, or endure situations that require the exertion or mustering of effort or force

Node.gloss: to clear the guilty|to hold not guilty|to let one go unpunished
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities pronounce or consider a person innocent or cleared of wrongdoing and freed from punishment

Node.gloss: to clear the guilty|to hold not guilty|to let one go unpunished
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities pronounce or consider a person innocent or cleared of wrongdoing and freed from punishment
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= process by which a strong wind blows, ► causing destruction and inspiring fear; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God and used as a symbol of warfare and hardship
= a strong movement of air, ► causing destruction; ≈ often associated with the appearance and intervention of God
literally: road; hence: = action by which humans are travelling from one place to another
= a visible collection of condensed water vapor hanging in the atmosphere, often high above the ground ≈ also used to represent God's presence and activity

= finely powdered substance, laying on the ground or on other objects or carried about by the wind; ◄ consisting of earth, soot, or other material; ≈ often associated with conditions that are transitory and do not endure

= the lower part of the lower limb of the body of humans, animals, and by extension of deities, which in some contexts may include the full leg; ► used for standing and walking; ≈ associated with authority, and also used as a euphemism for the male genitals
= action by which humans or deities speak to animals, humans, deities, or natural objects in anger, in order to express their displeasure and cause them to change their behavior
= a large and deep body of water which collects in a depression of the land; containing either salt water or fresh water
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence are caused to lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= flowing body of water

Node.gloss: to make dry|to cause to dry up
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause a state of dryness; ► in the case of land, if this condition persists, sedentary life will become impossible

= state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= mountain; ◄ located in north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) overlooking the Mediterranean Sea
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there

= state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation
= a relatively high elevation of the earth’s surface; generally higher than a hill (גִּבְעָה)
= an elevation of the earth’s surface rising gradually and to a relatively small height from the surrounding level; generally lower than a mountain (הַר)
= process by which a relatively hard object becomes softer

Node.gloss: to become high|to be lifted up
Node.definition: = process by which an object increases in height

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
primarily used in poetry: = the earth as opposed to the sky, with special focus on the area that is inhabited by humans
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
= action by which humans or deities express their intense anger; ◄ caused by someone else's behavior, ► almost invariably resulting in punishment for the party that is responsible

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
literally: kindling of anger; hence: = process by which the anger (אַף) of deities is aroused ◄ like a fire that is kindled
= state of extreme displeasure; ≈ often associated with fire and smoke
= state in which humans and deities experience excitement ◄ caused by anger

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= mass of rock projecting and forming an elevation
= state in which humans and deities have character, integrity, and good fortune
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= large fortification; for the defense of a town; built of stone; could consist of one extra strong building or of a complex of buildings surrounded by its own strong wall; ≈ associated with protection and security and often used as an epithet for God

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
literally: to know; hence: = state in which humans or deities are actively involved in circumstances relating to the life of humans and animals and care for their well being
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety
= literally: finish; hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans and objects to completely disappear from existance

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

= state in which there is no light, ◄ caused by the fact that the light of sun, moon, and stars cannot reach the location that is in focus, ► resulting in a state in which no one can readily see, and colors and shapes can no longer be distinguished; loved by the wicked only; ≈ associated with hardship, ignorance, death, and oblivion

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= literally: finish; hence: = causative action by which humans and deities cause (other) humans and objects to completely disappear from existance
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to cause to happen|to bring about
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause events to take place without them having to necessarily be involved in the event itself
literally: foot; hence: = a single instance in a range of repeated events
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
particle linking an event to an object; = relation indicating that the main argument of event X is comparable to object Y

exact meaning unsure: = thorny plant, ◄ possibly Sarcopoterium spinosum or Thorny or Spiny Burnet; ► known for making a crackling sound when burning, for overgrowing an entire building when no longer in use, and for being so entangled that they are impenetrable
= to twine about one another
= kind of alcoholic beverage

Node.gloss: to drink in excess|to be a drunkard
Node.definition: = action by which humans consume alcoholic beverages in large quantities, ► which results in drunkenness and other forms of loose behavior, ≈ and is generally regarded as foolish and unacceptable
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= dry grass like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned
= state in which objects are free from moisture
literally: full; hence: = state in which a particular process has come to a full end, without having been cut short

Node.gloss: to come out of (a group)|to be one of a group
Node.definition: literally: to come out (of a group); hence: = process by which humans are a member of a certain community
= action by which humans or deities exercise their minds in order to determine a course of action that will achieve a certain purpose
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering
= a person whose official role and responsibility it is to give advice to someone in authority

possible literal meaning: without benefit or without success; hence: = state in which someone is considered an objectional human being who is engaged in evil behavior and does not contribute to the society in a positive way

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place
= state in which objects or events are numerous in quantity or frequency

Node.gloss: to pass by|to shear|to shave|to cut off
Node.definition: = process by which events take place and time passes by|= causative action by which humans cut off their hair, or the wool of a sheep or other animal|meaning unsure; possibly: = causative action by which someone removes part of a previously integrated unit
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
literally: to bow down; hence: = causative action in which a humans or deities cause (other) humans to suffer hardship and trouble, ► resulting in a state of inability to help oneself
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= wooden pole ► secured to the necks of animals or human beings with the help of a rope to restrict movement or to prevent escape; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to denote oppression
= material used to tie objects together or to tie animals or humans; ≈ associated with power and control over something or someone else
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= action by which humans scatter seeds or plant young plants in a field so that they may grow into a new crop; ≈ associated with the concept of investing in order to get a return; also associated with reproduction and perpetuation
= one or more words by which a person, deity, place or object is known, addressed, remembered, or referred to; ≈ regarded as a core element of one's identity

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: to cut off; hence: = causative process by which a certain category of people or animals are removed from a particular group
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ carved out of wood and sometimes stone, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= a physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing; ◄ made by pouring molten metal into a mold, ► and functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship
= causative action by which deities call objects to existence

= place where one or more people are buried, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, stench and decay, uncleanness

Node.gloss: to be worthless|to be insignificant|to be of no account
Node.definition: = state in which humans have a reduced value or reduced importance, mostly in the eyes of someone else
